intro: Capraria ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leafed capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, three-lobed leaves. Capraria ternifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
